page.title: 16Local history Flintham.
page.content: {Flintham Hall}is a listed building with an important{conservatory}built by Hine. Until about 30 years ago a high % of the village was employed by the Estate and even today approx 30 houses still belong to the Estate although it's employees barely reach double figures. Until 1945 Trinity College, Cambridge owned several farms in the village. The village boasts 2{mud dovecotes,}& an ancient{pinfold,}recently restored. Many of the buildings built in the C18 are sideways to the road, apparently because an early 'squire' objected to being seen as he rode down the street. On Inholms Road is the old Reading Room besides what was the village pond now drained and used as a camping ground by the Scouts, except in winter when it fills with water from the Vicarage Field.
